event.title: settled a station in the area in 1776

data.event: Joseph Houston settled a station in the area in 1776, but was forced to relocate due to prior land grants.

In 1786, Lawrence Protzman purchased the area of present-day Paris from its owners, platted 250 acres (100 ha) for a town, and offered land for public buildings in exchange for the Virginia legislature making the settlement the seat of the newly formed Bourbon County.
In 1789, the town was formally established as Hopewell after Hopewell, New Jersey, his hometown.

event.title: The next year, though, it was renamed

data.event: The next year, though, it was renamed Paris after the French capital to match its county and honor the French assistance during the American Revolution.
It was incorporated as Paris in 1839 and again in 1890.
